name: calcify
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] to become hard or make something hard, especially by the addition of substances containing calcium: Foetal bones begin to calcify at about 13 weeks. He has a form of arthritis that calcifies the spine.
[ I ] (of ideas, systems, methods, etc.) to become fixed and difficult to change over a period of time: Historians are given to firm opinions that in time can calcify into rigid ones. Tight cliques grew and calcified over the years, and strangers were regarded with hostile wariness.
